document.text:
From: BOBBI C STERNHEIM 
To: 
Cc 
Subject: [EXTERNAL] Re: 20cr330 - US v. Maxwell 
Date: Fri, 15 Oct 2021 17:55:58 +0000 
Good afternoon-
Names followed by phone numbers indicate individuals planning to attend the 10/21 teleconference. 
Names followed by 11/1 indicates attendance at the in-person conference. 
Counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell 
(Each lawyer may each speak but only per issue) 
Bobbi C. Stemheim, Esq. 10/21 & 11/1) 
Christian Everdell, Esq. 10/21 & 11/1) 
Laura Menninger. Esq. (10/21 & 11/1) 
Jeffrey Pagliuca. Esq. (10/21 & 11/1) 
Ann Lundberg (paralegal) (11/1 only) 
Family/Friends 
Ian Maxwell 
Kevin Maxwell 
Pandora Maxwell 
Philip Maxwell 
Anne Holve 
Katie Vaughan Edwards 
Brian Basham - 
Isabel Maxwell 
EFTA00016726

Christine Maxwell 
Leah Saffian 
Jeff Roth 
Please contact me with any questions. 
Thank you. 
Bobbi 
Please note my new office address and preferred email address: 
BOBBI C. STERNHEIM, ESQ. 
Law 
Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim 
225 Broadway, Suite 
715 
New York, NY 10007 
This message and any attached documents contain information from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim 
that may be confidential and/or privileged. 
If you are not the intended recipient, you may not read, copy, distribute, or use this information. 
If you have received this transmission in error, please notify the sender immediately by reply e-mail and 
then delete this message. Thank you. 
On Oct 
13, 2021, at 8:27 PM 
Counsel: 
The Court is currently in the process of planning logistics for the October 21 teleconference and the 
in-person November 1 pretrial conference. 
wrote: 
The Court requests that each party provide their best and current estimate of the number of case 
related participants who will attend each proceeding (including attorneys, paralegals, victims, and 
family members). Please provide this information via email no later than Friday, October 15 at 10:30 
a.m. 
The Court also requires additional information specific to each conference. 
For the October 21 teleconference, the Court will docket a public access dial-in number. There will 
be a separate dial-in line for party participants to ensure access. Please provide the telephone 
numbers of the attorneys, and any victims and Defendant family members who will attend. Also 
please specify the name and number of those who plan to speak during the conference so that they 
can be unmuted. Bear in mind that Judge Nathan will enforce a one attorney speaking per issue rule. 
EFTA00016727

For the November 1 in-person conference, the District Executive's Office requires counsel to provide 
the number of people who plan to attend for their party (including attorneys, paralegals, victims, and 
family members) and the vaccination status of each person. This will help the Court plan in 
accordance with the Districts COVID-19 protocols. 
Please provide the conference-specific information via email as soon as possible but no later 
than Monday, October 18 for the information regarding the October 21 teleconference, and no later 
than Friday, October 22 for the information regarding the November 1 conference. 
Sincerely, 
Chambers of the Hon. Alison J. Nathan 
EFTA00016728
